thread.title: Streetcar construction down to 9 weeks; first vehicle will arrive in October
thread.title_full: Streetcar construction down to 9 weeks; first vehicle will arrive in October

author: Austin Alonzo
title: Streetcar construction down to 9 weeks; first vehicle will arrive in October
text:
Streetcar construction down to 9 weeks; first vehicle will arrive in October Aug 27, 2015, 12:47pm CDT Industries & Tags Austin Alonzo Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Austin Alonzo Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Home of the Day City of Kansas City The interior of the streetcar vehicle being built by CAF USA Inc. in Elmira, N.Y. Kansas City now expects its first streetcar vehicle will be delivered by the end of October. On Thursday, City Engineer Ralph Davis , a streetcar project manager, said the city was able to move the delivery date up by a number of weeks from the early December delivery date the vehicle manufacturer — CAF USA Inc. — proposed in July. Davis did not give a date for when the second, third and fourth vehicles will be delivered nor did he say when the 2.2-mile streetcar line will open. "We'll look at the process and see what we can do," he said. Construction of the streetcar line is moving ahead as expected — just nine weeks remain until completion.
